Has some hop aroma, and a hint of some of that lager familiar roughness, and there is also an lingering mouth taste, but this sets no benchmarks or level to achieve for competitors other than that is’s dead easy to drink, and drink a lot of I imagine, non confrontational, low engagement, not a lot to like, and not a lot to make you not like it if its offered other than it’s all rather a bit ’meh’

very light yellow,
poor head,
no bitterness.
maybe it’s not as bad when treat it like a different drink,
but as a beer it’s not a good representant ;)

640ml bottle, 4.7%. Pale gold gold, dissipating white head. The aroma is vague light malt, lightly grassy. The flavour is light malt, some sweetnes. Dry. A good replacement for water (but remarkably similar) at this particular Chinese restaurant.
Bottle. Aromaty słodowe, ryżowe, poprawne. Bardzo jasne, słomkowe widać że z ryżem. W smaku bardzo lekkie, ryżowe.
Yellow golden clear body, white head, quickly to fall. Aromas of grains and adjuncts. Pretty much the same taste, nice sweetness. Light body with medium carbonation.

China’s best known beer, a classic Asian lager with rice, which reveals itself as a sweetish graininess with sourish hint and adds a certain complexity; otherwise a bland pale lager, of course, but I can appreciate its soft and aromatic character.

$4.25 for the bottle. Purchased at dilapidated cowboy dive in town. Tastes and smells of rice malt syrup, LME, cat urine, bread yeast. Boring but cohesive. Very pale. Stringy mouthfeel; not a weird texture, I just didn’t find it accompanyingly soft.

Aroma: Rice, floral; Appearance: clear urine, minimal head; Taste: slight bitterness, medium sweetness, slight sourness; Palate: abrupt finish, slick texture, average carbonation, medium body 

Nice aromatic Rice lager, with some depth.

0,33l bottle at Sternzeichen/Wien 3. Mild and quite drinkable. Not bad.......

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Het riekt nog lekker maar de smaak is gewoon water, stijl van Heineken. Echt een tegenvaller
Très pale. Très inodore. Très fade. A boire très fraiche quand on a très soif. Fait comme même plaisir quand on a pris un plat trop pimenté chez le chinois ...

Blonde claire à la mousse éphémère. Malt et maïs au nez avec des parfums très légers d’herbes quelconques et du sucre. Son goût n’est pas des plus intéressants, mais ce n’est pas surprenant. Du malt encore, du sirop imprécis avec un aspect poivré. Une effervescence crée un espèce de tourbillon lors de son passage en bouche. Elle ressemble à n’importe quelle bière commercial. Version à 4,5% (1191-170814)
From 0,33L bottle. No top, clear straw colour. Waterly with bitter end. Very poor palate. Maybe just good to flush some food. Bad beer.
Very mild aroma. Clear golden colour with no head. Nice light flavours with a crisp finish. Light body with low to medium carbonation.
330ml bottle drank at hengshan picardie hotel shanghai (China). Yellow colour. White head. First impression : watery, bubbles, slightly malt.

Aroma: perfume de flores, frutas y bastante arroz, un poco de goma de mascar y vainilla.
Apariencia: Cabeza minima que desaparece de inmediato. Cuepo amarillo verdoso cristalino y cn poca efervesencia.
Sabor ligeramente amargo.
Paladar:Cuerpo ligero, textura ligetamente aceitosa, ligerisima carbonatación. un final ligerisima mente amargo de poca duracion.

Una cerveza bastante plana
Weak watery mouthfeel, floral hops, grains, some bread yeast, skunky aroma. This is not a very good beer!
Bottle, pours clear gold with a white head, aroma is sweet malt, taste is also sweet malt, very little bitterness, still thin and watery, not that great
Faint aroma. Gold and crystal clear. Little head. Very watery very little flavor

Its a pilsener. But a pilsner with little taste and character. When cooled prperly it’s refreshing on a hot day (but hey wich pilsener isn’t?). But that pretty much sums up the beer. Boring and tasteless

12 oz. bottle. Appearance: pale straw, clear. Aroma: rice wine, skunky, yeast. Palate: average carbonation, light body, thin texture. Taste: light malty into light bitter. Overall, nothing notable, good beer when its a free beer.

Drink cold (8°C)
Eye: pale yellowish colour with fast dissipating white head. big as well as small bubbles.
Nose: not much to smell. perhaps grass
Mouth: rice, grass, paper, hops
Palate: hops, short finish
Overall: not my favourite at all

0,33 l botttle. Bought in a german Lidl market. Left from last asia-weeks special offers? Not really cheap with 69 ct. The alcohol is listed on the backside label with 4.7%. Pours out very clear and watery golden in the glass. White head, very short living. Not a lot on the nose, maybe a little bit citrus with rice. Starts thin malty with citrus. Later cardboard, light citrus, little bit scratchy. Hints of hay in the afteraste. Not be worth to ship from so far away.
Green bottle with sushi dinner. Pours a light golden color with white head. Pretty typical light lager.
0,3l Flasche. Sehr helles Lager mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Kaum Geruch, sehr leichtes Bier.
Bottle. Overall a nice lager, not too much carbonation. Worked well with Korean food.
golden, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour,

Bottle in Shanghai, China. Pours a golden yellow with a white head. It is your basic pale lager. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale blonde, moderate abundant irregular bubbles and non-persistent foam.On the nose, it releases the smell of low-malt rice and hops. The rice malt gives a nice lightness to the in the mouth. The final low intensity is dominated by aromas of rice and a sharp or slightly astringent bitterness.
Couleur jaune claire, petite mousse blanche. Nez très leger malté. Gout pareil malté et aqueux. Rien d’exceptionel.
640 ml bottle bought in lidl croatia. Medium white head that last longer than most lagers. Tastes like average lager but without any aftertaste.
Pale and watery with some unpleasant astringency, otherwise fairly clean and refreshing with a pronounced (if cheap) maltiness.
0.33 l bottle as gift... Clear golden color, average head... Standard Lager beer, nothing special, but refreshing and drinkable...

330ml bottle poured into over sized Tripel Karmeliet tulip. A: Pale, straw colour, clear, lively looking, one finger head which didn’t stick around long. S: Faint malt and grass. T: Malt forward, on the sweet size, slightly watery. M: Crisp and well carbonated. O: As far as AALs go this is OK. It’s bland but inoffensive, good hot day beer.
Poors golden with some weak Head basically not much of smell nor aroma. Very thin beer.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour. Weak aroma, a bit malty, pretty watery. No specific taste, light bitterness.

hvala Lidl trgovini na ovoj pivi , popio ga u drustvu s pivopijom Vedranom....a sta da kazem ...nekakav neopisiv okus ..tezak..bez alkohola..gust okus koji ostaje u grlu ..grozno pivo ..ocekivao sam puno vise ...steta..
Pours a clear light yellow with white head. Skunk at first, then cereal grains on the nose; follows onto the palate.
Bottle from a restaurant in rome. Yellow beer with white halo. Grassy and mild aroma. Taste is same sweet and slightly dry, metallic and watery. Prickly carb, thin body. Not great.
Bottle. Pours clear gold with bright white head. Spicy, grassy, sweaty aroma. Taste is minimal malt, old flannel, low sweetness & flavour, finishes dry. Pretty bad.
An easy to drink Chinese lager beer. A bit boring and tasteless but good as a thirst quencher.
Colour yellow with white head gone quickly, weak aroma, taste of grains, floral, light body, average carbonation, poor character, quite refreshing though.

Tsingtao pours clear golden and its head dissipates far too quickly. The nose is a compound of grainy and floral notes with a hint of acetaldehyde. There is a distinct lack of any flavor from front to mid-palate, followed by a faint hint of the floral note and the taste of steamed rice stay with the alcohol afterglow in the finish with light acidity. The carbonation is a tad too soft, but the mouthfeel overall isn’t anything offensive. Meh.

0,33 bottle with red label and 4.7% vol. Very pale colour, like lemon juice, almost no head. Aroma is crisp, with weak herbal hops. Light bitterness, maybe a bit sour. Watery, soft carbonation. Not bad, but nothing interesting in it.
Called the local chinese restaurant for food and this bottle came as a gift. No taste, no flavour, nothing else to do but pour a healthy dose of Picon bière into it...

640 ml bottle. Very pale yellow, completely clear, with a tiny frothy white head which went away immediately leaving no lacing. On the nose grain, corn, rice, wet cardboard. Very hard to expand on the taste. Just grainy, vegetable-like, extremely sweet and cloying. No malt or hop bitterness whatsoever. Papery and dusty aftertaste. Average carbonation, light to medium body, slightly creamy texture. Easily forgettable.
Almost no aroma just a hint of malt. Pale golden color with a white well laced head. Tastes like a poor man’s Heineken hint of malts and nuts. Watery feel no aftertaste.

Wer hat noch kein Tsingtao im China Restaurant probiert. Farbe und Geruch sind gold und leichte Noten von Würze, vielleicht auch ein Minihauch von Citrus und Frucht. Schaumkrone ist erst bescheiden aber beim zweiten einschenken dann besser. Die Bierkomposition ist nicht unstimmig und auch fehlerfrei, aber vom Einstieg schon merkt man hier ist wenig Pep drin. Leichte süssliche Note die etwas unterstützt wird vom Echo einer Fruchtnote im Körper und Abgang. Insgesamt kein schlechtes Bier, aber auch kein Gutes.

After reading the above note, clearly this was the beer I had under the same ABV. 
Though after having this more than enough times in the bottle and having it in a pint glass, I’ve also been able to get it in a pilsener glass as well. 
Here’s the rest. 
The appearance was a nice light yellow color with strong rising carbonation to fill a rapidly dissipating head. There was some light lacing but it slid right on into the beer somewhat quickly. 
The smell had a generic cooked corn like substance but somehow maybe even be rice that was in as well or possibly just itself. 
The taste was semi - sweet and had a slight quick sweet clean and crisp finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a pretty good sessionability about it causing it to go well with food. The carbonation was somewhat crisp yet smooth. 
Overall, decent pale lager that’s worthy of coming back though the smell seemed a bit weak.
This is a light beer. Macro feel but very refreshing. Pairs nicely with some spicey food from the East Village.
Bardzo jasne piwo o dość ładnej pianie, aromat przyjemny choć niezbyt intensywny, w smaku wodniste ze śladową goryczką.
Een heerlijk verfrissende pilsener met een lekkere zoete smaak. Weinig schuim maar mooi helder.

Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll. Pale lemon colour with decent head. Faints of citrus and pear. Generally less of the artificial metallic notes I tend to find in most bog-standard lagers but otherwise really nothing special.
0,64l bottle. Golden color with quickly disappearing white head. Weak grainy aroma. Taste is sweet and skunky with bitter finish. Overall it’s pretty bad beer.

330ml bottle from Lidl.

Very pale colour, clear liquid with almost no head (which disappears immediately).

Very mild, boring taste.

Quite horrible corny and grassy hop aroma after bottle opening. After tasting its quite gone, at least unpleasant aspects. Still its very watery, bit malty, some grain, rice, light hops. Basically sweet with light bitterness.
In proper temperature very refreshing and quite balanced for so watery brew. If you are thirsty, then this is one good watery thirst quencher with some qualities of beer

zapach skunksa (zielona butelka) do tego lekki chmiel (zioła) i słody. przyzwoity, ale nie urzeka. kolor bardzo jasny, jasnosłomkowy. piana jak z pepsi, mała i momentalnie znika. w smaku dość pusto. lekka słodowość, kukurydza, lekka kwaśność i niska ale wyczuwalna goryczka która momentalnie znika. pozostawia dość nieprzyjemne, suche uczucie w ustach. spodziewałem się, że będzie dużo gorzej, choć za premium lagera to bym tego nie uznał.

Bottle from Lidl. Extra Pale with minimal head. Mild aroma. Mild taste with sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale golden with a white head - some malts in the aroma - malt body with some bitterness in the back - short malt finish - This was ok, especially with a hot spicy chinese meal
Czuć estry owocowe i skarpetę. Kolorek słoma, klarowny. Smak płaski, minimalna goryczka. Pijalność średnia, łatwo wchodzi. Ogólnie nie polecam, raczej do podlewania grilla niźli do spożycia.

It has a very pale straw color that is very clear with lots of visible carbonation. The head is thin, white in color and fades out quickly leaving no lace behind. Its aroma has big floral nose with light grainy malts along with a light skunky smell. Despite the skunk in the aroma the flavor is very clean with mild floral and delicate grainy sweetness followed by a mild bitterness in the finish. It has an easy drinking light body with just enough fizzy carbonation to give it some life.
Clear, golden colour with minimal white head. Weak aroma of malt and hop. Low bitterness, medium sweetness. Medium carbonation, little watery mouth-feel. Typical international lager. Not interesting.

Tsingtao premium lager o słomkowej barwie i słabej pianie. Dzięki niemu poznałem zapach kanalizy w piwie. Nie jest to najmilszy z zapachów. Po tym nowym doświadczeniu zabrałem się za ocenę goryczki tu jak na lagera przyzwoicie - coś jest, może niezbyt szlachetna ale jest. Później odczucie w ustach i tu kolejna wada - drętwienie języka. Smak natomiast zaskakujący, czyli czysty, orzeźwiający. Niestety po lekkim ogrzaniu się trunku wyszedł alkohol w smaku.

Bottle at a sushi restaurant. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have extremely mild corn, grainy malt, soft rice notes, mild bitterness and a hint of ginger (or was that from the sushi?). This is cold, wet alcohol and just a tick.
Color is pale gold. Small initial head and vanish very fast. Low carbonation. Body is watery. Aroma is malt and rice. Low bitterness and some sweeterness. Aftertaste is very abrupt and bitter.

Piwo butelkowe. Kolor bursztynowy klarowny, piana całkiem niezła lecz nie powala. W zapachu o dziwo dosyć chmielowo, ziołowo. W smaku wodniście ale gorycz na przyzwoitym poziomie lecz bez cudów. Ogółem jak na chinola to wielkie zaskoczenie ale nie przesadzajmy.
Bottle. Very small,unstable, white head. In aroma mostly metalic notes. Colour is light golden. In taste pharmaceutical and metalic notes.

Aroma: malts, rice.
Appearance: clear straw color, white head.
Taste: low bitterness, sweetness, pharmaceutical aftertaste, rice.
Palate: low body and high carbonation, artificial aftertaste.
Overall: What should I say ? Tragedy.
Low scores on the board. I like it for what it is. Goes down easy. Certainly not great, but I found it quite drinkable.

Awesome, glad developing countries are producing shitty beer too. I would hate to have to drink North American junk in other countries. The same old song and dance in an exotic package. Grainy and metallic, crisp and light, carbonated to high hell and primed to enjoy with spicy foods.
tepid transparent lemon, no head. Light rice and lemon nose, tons of cardboard and paper, especially in the sticky flavor, hints of dough with syrupy corn sweetness through finish.
Can shared at DC Annual Epic Sour Tasting, thanks Travlr! Straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of skunk, sweet fruit. Tastes of skunk, citrus, wheat. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

From a cans hared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Thanks Travlr! Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Light malty nose and flavors. Save this one to go with Szechuan cuisine where its many flaws will be masked while helping to put out the flames in your mouth.
hay, cereal, grass, golden, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, lively
Bottle. Golden, clear, minimal head, medium bitterness, light body, flat, & bitter finish.

Dreadful. Tingy, metal, water tastes prosessed, so this is a double whammy. If served next to freezing then it can be drunk with whatever South East Asian food when there’s no other beer alternatives. Fun fact, I last had this in a Thai restaurant in Johannesburg, South Africa.
Can. Golden color with small fast-disappearing head. Malty aroma. Light sweet taste. Watery texture. Absolutely nothing interesting. South beer.

Very golden pale appearance with a fair bit of carbonation, aroma is very hoppy as one might expect from a lager, but is actually quite pleasant, not too overpowering. Taste is very typical of a lager but a refreshing palate, perfectly acceptable but not something to choose over any craft ale.
Pour golden with a thin fizzy white head that dissipates quickly. Thin body with a weak corn taste. Hardly any aroma.

330 ml bottle sample at Pho Van Van Ottawa. Pours a pale clear gold with a large pillowy white head. Aromas are a little funk, adjuncts (rice or corn), and a little chalkiness. Tastes are spent grain, a little alcohol, and mild tinny bitterness. Very thin and watery, strong carbonation and a medium tinny finish. Blech!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, getreidig. Geschmack leicht malzig, wässrig, getreidig, minimal herb.
Lys gul med hvitt luftig skum. Lukter malt og noe sitrus. Tynn leskende lager. Noe tam. Tørstedrikke!
Backlog. Tried it bottled. Just your standard mass-produced lager. Nothing to get excited about.
Cerveza industrial, suave, refrescante y fácil de beber, no hace falta destacar nada mas
Pours a straw colour with s small head. Aroma notes include sweet malts, spiciness, and grass. Tasting notes include sweet malts, with a very watery body and a slight bitter finish.
Lys bruktbil klar med tynt hvitt skum. Sitron, kornete lukt. Tam i smak og munn. Litt syrlig, lite kullsyre og bitterhet.

12 oz bottle from Hong Kong Buffet in Muscatine, poured into a small mug. Gold and clear with a fully diminishing white head. Mild aroma of rice, corn, pale malts and light hops. Similar flavor, crisp with light bitterness and light malt sweetness. Light body with plenty of carbonation. Bland.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Hiper Oriente. Color dorado. Sabor muy suave. Muy comercial, sin cuerpo y de baja calidad.

Good refreshing beer. Nice aroma but has a some what bitter taste. White head that disapears slowly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Butelka. Lekkie i całkiem orzeźwiające. W aromacie jakby belgijskie drożdżowe nuty. mocno schłodzone jest ok.
De l’eau pétillante mais avec un mauvais goût en plus. Pour le folklore dans les resto chinois.

I really do not like this beer, it is really easy to get in The Netherlands, but i do not know why. Because it is not good. We have quiet good beers in our land, why would we import this? The bottle is beautiful.
Straw coloured with a large white head, no lacing. Faint aroma of malt, cereal and grassy hops. Taste is sweet with malt, bitterness and a hint of fruit. A bit too sweet. It’s alright.
33 cl bottle. Pours clear blond. Discreet aroma, some hints of rice. Watery mouthfeel and no bitterness. However, ok beer as a thirst quencher.
0.5l bottle. Pours light golden with medium white head. Taste is light malt, corn and hops. Not much aroma. Average carbonation. Not that great beer, but drinkable.
bottle served at a chines restaurant. weak watery mouthfeel, floral hops, grains, rice?, some bread yeast, skunky aroma. no this wasn’t a great beer
Bottle in Shangai, Cesky Krumlov. Stinky and very watery. Corny with bad aftertaste. Even had suspicions about the expiration date but it was OK.
Comme beaucoup de bière du monde celle ci n’a pas vraiment de goût, juste une bière pour dire que je ne bois pas de l’eau malgrès que les deux liquides sont très proches.

12 oz bottle; a gift from a software developer who grew up in the town where this was brewed. Thanks dude. Crystal clear piss yellow with a brief head. Nose is grain, skunk and lemon pith. Medium light but substantial for a lager. Taste is citrus pith, a bit metallic, sour apple and grass. A decent choice with Chinese.
Bottle from Thai Pepper. Pours transparent gold with a very thin layer of cream colored head. Aroma of cheap malts. Taste pretty much the same.
Bottle from Salling, Aarhus. Clear yellow color with a white head. Aroma/ taste of sweet malts, corn. Sweet watery finisf.

Pours a translucent golden with barely any head and some watery lacing. Smell is very faint, some corn and dry lager aroma. Taste is more corn and some very faint malt, crisp and bone dry. This is obviously not a particularly special, flavourful beer, but it has no pretentions of being one either - for a cheap mass produced lager, this is one I wouldn't mind returning to.
Tsingtao is always a good widely available go to. It's got enough flavor and body to go with most food.
Not any where near as bad as I had thought, did have it super cold on a Friday afternoon as soon as work finished so that may have affected the rating.

33cl bottle.
Appearance:Very pale yellow and clear colour, decent white head but poor retention.
Aroma: Sweet with some light malts
Taste: Sweet Malty, rice
 fizzy (over)carbonated, thin body

Very pale and clear colour, decent head but with large and even bubbles.I couldn’t smell anything here, maybe skunk. Body is very light, malt is OK in flavour -- not great but in the category of a fresh loaf of white bread with sugar on top. Watery finish, not crisp. To me, there’s not a lot of hops. maybe crisp, maybe no flavour
Pretty watery. Not a bad taste, but nothing really distinctive either. Good to quench your thirst on a hot day, nothing more.
Light grain aroma. Clear light yellow color with a small white head. Very light beginning with a sour malt finish.
Couleur jaune pisse. Peu de goût, mais légère et désaltérante. En bouche, coprs absent, goût d’eau !
A pretty good lager. Has a bit of nice bitterness, and is easier to drink. Not as watery as some others.
Licht zoete smaak, heldere lichtgele kleur. Een bier wat zeker aan te bevelen is. Smaak valt snel weg, blijft niet erg hangen.Smaak doet aan versgemaait gras denken.

Aroma: some light malts. Appearance: clear gold, medium frothy head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: some malty sweetness coming up, continues lightly bitter. Overall: better than average Pale Lager. Bottle at Cathay Pacific Lounge Charles de Gaulle, Paris.

Aroma: bland malt character. ..some base carbonationTaste : very pale bland malt characters with some basic bitterness. Dry rice tang pretty apparentAppearance : clesr light gold body with a fairly poorly retained head
Light and a bit watery. Not a lot going on but it definitely quenched my thirst.
Light, very refrehing but on the bland side. Good match with spicy food but not memorable.

Light body and medium carbonation. Refreshing, but has no real taste to it. Drinking it very cold, it is a very nice refreshing beer on a hot summer’s day due to its "waterness" or if you’re in a country where you don’t dare to drink the tap water. Otherwise very unspectacular.
Sample at the store. Poured light yellow with visible carb and bubbly white head. Aroma of corn malt and minor hop. Med carb light bod. Weak flavors mostly corn. Free

(Bottle).  With lunch at Hunan Taste in Denville.  A watery but not offensive flavor that pairs well with Chinese food.  
 
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
660ml bottle poured into a tulip glass. Head soon fades. Corn dominates. Okay with a stir fry.
quelques commentaires assez rudes pour une bière correcte. Plus douce qu’amère, mais appréciable par grand soif!
Light body and medium carbonation. Refreshing, but it feels like has no really taste. Could be better.

Bottled, 330 ml.
Pours yellow with a medium sized fluffy white head on its top.
Clean malty nose and aroma with honey and notes of bread, mouthfeel is thin.
Short, rather sweet finish escorted by shy grassy hops and light citrusses.
Thirstquencher.
Good aroma, nice color and very sweet, has a good after taste, a bit tart, but over all very good.

they tried to mimic a beer without any success: very pale yellow colour some white head; aroma and taste of something sour; ok, this is definitely not a beer...’premium lager’ must be a joke...maybe they missed the ’plan’ there at China mixing it at least partly with the recipe of pickles...or the plan of a cell phone, or something else...it is not really closer to be a beer than a glass of urine, or chinese fake coke, or a microprocessor, or the great wall, or anything else which is not a beer...I really sorry those people, who believe that this is a beer...
Bottle morrisons. Clear pale straw colour thin white head. Aroma is malts ad hops. Taste is same but so watery that’s all u notice. Thin to medium body very gassy carbonation. Not good but drinkable.
660ml bottle from Tesco. Put of all the pissy so-called premium lagers I’ve rated recently, I think this has been the worst. Awful. Had half, the rest was put to better use in the gravy.
lear straw, tiny head. Grassy hops, malty sweetness, touch of sour apple fruityness. Light body, average carbonation and bitter, tad metallic aftertaste. Drinkable.

Moins pire que ce que l’on peut penser au premier abord. Bien meilleure qu’une Kro, la Tsin Tao n’est pas non plus une bière exceptionnelle. Peu de goût, mais légère et désaltérante. Son avantage, fin de bouche agréable et pas de goût d’eau comme ses consœurs.
Bottle in Shanghai. Pissy gold, no head at all. Straw, corn and hops. Light bubbly body. Not overly nasty, but nothing to enjoy here.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: 0.5L mug 
From: Beer Advocate’s heresy22
Price: N/A
Purchased: Received it on Jan. 1, 2014
Consumed: Jan. 3, 2014
Misc.: N/A

Thanks to Chris for the beer.

Poured a golden pale clear color with about one finger of light white head. Lots of bubbles coming up. Minimal lacing on the sides. Minimal retention.

Smelled lots of wheat and barley up front, reminding me slightly of a pilsner. Also got honey, cereal, hay and caramel. Not too bad for an AAJ.

Taste didn’t quite live up to the smell. Got watery honey malts, cereal, corn, grassy notes, hay and some caramel. Very bland.

Light body. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Watery, abrupt finish.

This beer had its moments for sure. I’d say above average for an American Adjunct Lager.

Bottle. Piss yellow with no head. Little carbonation. Unremarkable light lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Watery easy to drink lager that has light hops taste and some yeast in there, slightly better your average light american beer but not by much

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours pale yellow in color with little to no head. Not much substance to this beer. Made to be refreshing while eating spicy food maybe.

Bottle.

A- Grassy, corn, grains.

A- Golden color, clear liquid, minimal head.

T- Corn, grains, slightly bitter.

P- Light body, crisp texture, average carbonation, mild finish.

O- A good lager that goes well with Chinese dishes, obviously. One of the better Asian region lagers.

Nothing in this beer really works. Weird hop profile, thin malts, strange aroma. Mouthfeel isn’t awful. This beer seems to be prone to skunkiness. Best to mask it with overpowering food or gulp it down as quickly as possible... if you’re going to drink it.
Biere sans pretention, chere car importe, se boit sans difficulte, car pas de gout...pas desagreable au resto chinois
Tsingtao imported from China. Mistake on behalf for ordering this while I wait for Chinese. Bad Heineken!

Appearance: pours a thick white head which recedes leaving some lacing. Color is a pale straw. Small amount of streaming carbonation.

Aroma: lightly toasted barley malt, yeast, a bit of grassiness.

Mouthfeel: light, crisp, refreshing, with a dry finish.

Flavor: white bread, sweet malt, grass, slight hops in the finish.

Comments: Oh my goodness. My childhood memory of Tsingtao was quite decent, particularly the Export, which was very crisp, strong and tasty. Fast forward to present: this once reputable national brand has now become just another anonymous, lowly Asian macro released under a confusing array of abvs and degree Platos, almost all of them failed to impress. Back to this beer: its taste is considerably better than the all - cardboard Tsingtao 10°. Still, it’s a typical macros, with watery body, skunk, syrupy corn and rice, no hoppiness and after taste whatsoever. Tailor made for non-discerning consumers, very inoffensive, you can even consider it as decent by crappy macro standards. It could have been a nice substitution for Tsingtao 10° to cut down the chili heat of Sichuan cuisines. All being said and done, this is a tasting exercise went without a hitch and hopefully I don’t have to taste it again.

It serves its purpose well, but I won’t try it again unless all the alternatives are worse.

#50 Country Rating. 33 cl. bottle @ home – purchased @ semi-local Asian supermarket with the intent of finally ticking China as a country – my biggest Chinese want is still Snow Beer but since I figure I cannot really get hold of that one, this one should do the trick. Tsingtao Brewery was founded by German settlers – German brewing traditions appear to play still a significant role in Chinese brewing – in 1903. Its original name was actually even Germania-Brauerei (Germania Brewery). They are currently the second biggest Chinese brewery, claiming 15 % market share. Ownership appears to have been rather volatile over the years but Asahi appears to own the majority of the company these days, which must sort of hurt – I assume that most Chinese consumers are oblivious to these fact & most non-Chinese as well I am willing to bet. This beer here is their flagship and is supposed to be a pilsner, it is no longer brewed according to the Reinheidsgebot nor by using mineral water from the Laoshan Spring, this is a bit unfortunate but these days this is mostly just a big factory lager. Beer wise this remains still Chinese biggest export, I am certain that quite a few people will have no difficulty recognising and naming this beer, no other major Chinese export beers come to mind to me personally. The beer itself comes in a green bottle, perhaps aiming to play in the same “luxury” import market as for instance Heineken does in the states? I must add that the cap is in a lovely communist red. Anyway this hit has been a very, very long time I think since I drank anything that comes in a green bottle – I cannot say that I really missed it. As most export versions over here appear to, my version also states an ABV of 4.7 % The price was reasonable compared to similar offerings & taking the transportation costs into account. Poured into a catastrophically inappropriate glass, the beer itself is an unpleasant, extremely pale macro pilsner yellow, like the lightest cider outside with some non-lasting white bubbles for a head – it looks like a bottom of the barrel macro pilsner, it has been a while for me – this is unabridged, real deal. Smell is surprisingly not skunked but rather sweet, sweet, sugary, lemony urinal cakes with some grass and very cheap pastry. Taste is bitter watery grains, cardboard, hay, light bitter aluminium, old apples, that part is ok but unfortunately the aftertaste is rather horrendous, it has this gross chemical, artificial sweetness going on, like baking powder mixed with industrial warehouses, it has this bizarre sweetness to it, lightly metallic, you sort of get used to but the first couple of sips hit you. It feels stale with a definably noticeable watery side to it. What can I say, this is like the poster boy for factory made mass, industrial pale lagers, this is exactly what pops into my head when I think of these kinds of beers. This is what people drink ice-cold from the bottle whilst looking for a relaxing, slow, cheaper buzz.  This reminds me of Stella Artois. This can become almost agreeable, it is not that atrocious, unfortunately I do not feel like I am drinking the beer of the Chinese factory worker, this is what the city yuppies drink in China & privileged kids. I would dig this more if this felt like the Chinese common mans drink.
Bottle 0.33l from local market. Colour is clear yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavours are lemon, water and some malts.

From a December 2006 BA review: 330ml Green bottle, 4.5% according to the label, poured into a ’Straffe Hendrik’ bowl glass. 

No head apart from a very thin wispy collar around the glass, very light golden yellow, with bubbles rising towards the headless top. 

No aroma and no taste, rice maybe, my tastebuds had a laugh with me, I thought it was sweet at first, then a heavy dryness appeared and is all I can comment on, it does stay dry in the mouth, but it is not a beer I could recommend, even with a curry.

Pale golden in colour with a creamy white head. Smells of light malt and hops. Nice smell. Thin light chewey prickly body. Taste of cereal. Light nice soft bitter malt flavour with some corn. Watery but refreshing.

Clear yellow with foam quickly disappearing. Strange smell, sewer? Taste cannot be placed, I wouldn't know what it is. OK had my Chinese beer. (Houston 201205)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally reviewed: 1/17/09. My sister-in-law is Chinese, and when her and my brother came to town, they grabbed some of the beer that they drink over there. 

This poured the palest of yellows, with about an inch’s worth of head on top. This disappeared completely and left not the slightest of lacing rings. Smelled of rice and corn and some lemon. Smells like a Bud. 

This is an extremely watery thin brew. I’m sure this aids the "drinkability" but I don’t like this. All I’m tasting is the adjuntness; tastes fake. Some thin vegetable flavors. Very weak beer. Avoid.
Nothing to really write home about.  Crips and easy enough to drink.  Was a good beer to have on hand with some chilli wontons but by itself not an outstanding beer.
bottle. pale yellow pour. typical flavorless, mass produced lager. Little going on here. It is  what it is
330ml bottle, 4,7%. Clear yellow color. Small head, stays. Slight corn in aroma, sweet. Tastes light and watery.
This is a super light beer. It pretty much tastes like I am drinking a carbonated water. Good if you are thirsty.
Can’t believe I’ve never rated this guy. A typical skunked pale lager, but she’s refreshing on a hot day.

22/IV/2012 - 33cl bottle from Colruyt (Ledeberg) @ Bouvier’s place - BB: 5/IX/12 (2012-395) Thanks to Bouvier for the beer!


Aroma: some marijuana right upon opening the bottle, urine, lemon, pretty bad. Clear pale yellow beer, big white aery head, unstable, little adhesive. MF: ok carbon, light body. Taste: some bitterness, pretty sweet, very tasteless in general. Aftertaste: some lemon zest, little bitter. Oh well, another country ticked!
330ml bottle 4.7%. Clear yellow colour with small head. Some malt in flavour, bit sweet. Ok for hot summer day

Color giallo pallido con sottile schiuma bianca. Insulso aroma vagamente maltoso; gusto moderatamente dolciastro con una controparte luppolata davvero debole. Corpo insignificante, acquosa e quasi priva di retrogusto. Birra inutile.

The ratings honestly suprise me. A cheap asian pale lager, so I do not expect that much. however a 5 and 5 respectively are very low.

Aroma: Sweet, fresh hops. Not much aroma’s.
Appearance: I genuinely like the appearance of most pale lagers/pilsners. Color is very pale, bit sparkling, a very fast dissipating, small foam head. 

Taste: Taste is pretty standard for a mass-produced pale lager except a bit sweet and a bit lighter.

Palate: Palate might be the most dissapointing about this one, there’s just not much, very thin texture, very forced carbonation, finish very abrupt. 

Overall: I think this beer is underappreciated and or people expect to much. You’re buying a mass-produced pale lager from China, did you honestly expect a top-notch crafted beer? I like this pale beer with it sweet atertastes and summery hops.
(bottle 11/04-2012) low white head, clear light yellow color, soft co2, thin body, light yeast aroma, light sweet taste. BB date 09/07/2012.
Bottle at epcot.  Light golden color.  Med head.  Not much aroma.  Fairly smooth taste.  Grains and some barley wheat.  Ok.

330 ml bottle. Pours clear yellow with small white head that disappears completely. Slightly sweet aroma is skunky with mild hops, malt and rice. Mild taste has malt, hops and corn. Light bodied and watery mouthfeel. Strong carbonation. Quite tasteless beer and not even very refreshing, although that means no bad flavours either.
Sweeter than expected, crisp and clean. Not much lingering here though.......

Originally rated April 2005. China’s number one beer pours a light golden colour with a medium white head. The retention is not bad and the lacing is quite good. The first scent was sign of skunk (green bottle). After breathing a bit, you could detect sweet malt and some grass. This brew is above average in carbonation. The taste is slightly sweet with some hop finish. Pretty smooth and clean. They say on their site that the yeast and barley they use is imported from Canada... woohoo ! Good pilsner-style brew for those chinese supper.

Pours a light golden with initial 2 finger head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing skunky aroma. Very light toasted malt. Hint of resinous hops.  Moderate carbonation. Thin on the palate.  Moderate finish that is mildy bitter and mildly sour.  Not a memorable beer.
Nearly clear golden.  Fairly dry.  Light bitterness.  No body.   This is probably a fine premium lager, but I really hate this style.

12oz bottle - hit by the smell of a dead skunk as soon as the cap went pssst.  pours a glistening yellow that is very clear with quickly diminishing white head.  Nose is pilsner-like hops and yeast.  Flavor is rice/corn and sweet malts.  taste is light sweet with mild bitterness.  watery and light.  Stale aftertaste.  burpy.  I wouldn’t mind an imperial version of this.
This is a beer, apparently. Smells (and tastes) skunky with a faint citrus-esque note somewhere.  Will not be drinking this again.
light aroma,yellow,clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, light soft carbonation,nice cold.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow colour with a thin whitre head, no real aroma as such, the taste is bland  and very watery, with a dry finish.
raisin, earthy, bread, floral, pale, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, light body, thin feel,
This is a typical light, rice beer. Not much flavor, but it exceeds Bud or Miller or Coors due to the slight slight citrusy finish. Frothy white head quickly dissipates. The color is a light straw

Bottle. China and the United States can come together on one issue: they make some crap domestic beer. This wasn’t as bad as say an MGD or a Bud Light, but it was pretty watery and tasteless. There almost zero scent and what I could smell was cat piss. The appearance and palate were steady, but the taste was just so faint. Alcoholic water from China.
Very little aroma and next to no head retention. Sweet and slightly syrupy flavour. Okay to wash down your chop suey but doesn’t really stand up on its own.
Pours clear yellow with a thin off-white head and a skunky lager aroma.There is a dry light malt flavor with a hint of hop bitterness. Just a standard lager.
Een chinees bier dat ik niet lekker vind ruiken, smaak was wel goed. Gedronken bij dutchdrebus
Bottle. Pale yellow, white head. Standard lager fare. A ricey and mild syrupy smell. Rice-flavoured lager taste. Bready palate. Nice and refreshing, but not an exciting drink.
Weak looking lager, but has a decent enough fusion of regular and rice brewing.

From bottle, free courtesy of chop chop meal deal, thanks chop chop. Light yellow. Fairly typical lager aroma, yeasty, not great, some unpleasantness. Similar taste. Refreshing on the palate, fizzy. I think ’well hopped character’ is a bit of a misrepresentation.

Light in color, light on the head, and light on flavor.  The unique part of this beer is the stuff floating in it, makes you wonder what China is exporting.  Its a unique lager though, quite different than the mother of beers in Germany.

33cl bottle. Pale golden colour with a minimal formation of white head. Aroma is slightly corny and sweet. Flavour is light, soft and with a watery final. Carbonation is soft to medium. Body is light.

Pours a clear yellow with an initial head that disapears quickly and completely leaving no lacing on the glass. It has a slight skunky smell and rice aroma. It has a slight sweet flavor to it, with minimal hop presence.

Appearance: pale straw under a bubbly white head fading fast into oblivion. Swirls with a bubbly collar and nothing else substantial.


Nose: lemon, white bread, and corn kernels soaked, soggy, and waterlogged. Faint green grass in the back surrounded on all sides by watery mediocrity.


Palate: watery sweet white breads. Light and unassuming. Lemon and green grass along its watery edges. Artificial sweetness of saccharine corn oil. Salty hard minerals in the back.


Final Thoughts: serve it freezing cold or don’t serve it at all. Blech. I still find it difficult to ascertain anything redeemable in the category of mass-produced premium lagers of which Tsingtao falls. Moving on.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a clear medium yellow with a small fizzy head that fades away to nothing.

Smells like a bottled skunk. Once that fades there is strong metallic corn. A bit sweet.

Taste is grainy corn and a bit of metal. Very light hop bitterness that lingers through the finish. Mouthfeel is pretty watery.

Overall a pretty poor beer. I have had worse, though.

640ml bottle   very pale yellow with a loose white head that doesn’t last .
minimal aroma  - some grain and hops   . taste is slightly sweet with some grass , metallic finish   . thin watery  over carbonated  . totally unremarkable  . the only highlight is ticking off a chinese beer

I cannot believe this beer is the most sold in our Chinese Food Restaurants. Sorry but our country (France) is very poorly educated in Beer. 
Actually, this blend of corn, soap, waste water and bubbles should not be drunk at all ... I guess the same comments could be written with huge volume sellers brewed by "SM" and "I" Brewing Groups.
No-Cheers !
Bière blonde de 4.5 %. Odorat de « moufette », fort pétillante, minuscule col au versement, goût âcre en bouche. Arrière-goût fort prenant.

0,33l bottle . Pale yellow clear with white head, which sets quickly. Aromas sweet malts, grains. Palate thin watery with sweets taste, no hoppiness or bitterness what so ever. Very mild and flavourless. Drinkable, but mostly bulky. Balanced though.

UGHHH...had a Chinese restaurant (thought I would finally give it a try).
Pours a pale straw body with a thick inch of white soapy head that leaves no lacing. Grainy nose with a surprising hop aroma (still quite mild though). Light sweetness and cereal malts in the taste with a bit of hop astringency on the finish and a dry, clean finish. overall, not too bad.

12oz bottle. ABV unlisted. Label indicates that this was imported from Monarch, IL. Purchased from BellaVino in Athens, OH. Totally clear pale yellow color, minimal-to-no head, more than enough bubbles. Sharp carbonation. Boring, plain lager aroma -- not much there at all. Somewhat gingery, citrus tangy-sweet flavor is the only distinguishing characteristic.. This is just your typical macro-beer taste, slightly chalky unpleasant texture. Taste is slight tangy sweet. A boring pale lager, nothing special.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with 2 fingers of white head that settle quickly leaving no lacing behind.  Aroma is mild grains and hops.  Taste is light malty sweetness with a sharp hop bitterness which finishes clean.  Light body and mild carbonation.  A typical pale lager, but certainly not premium.

From the 12oz bottle at Orient Kitchen in Pittsburgh.  On the light side and rather crisp but without any body or distinct flavor.  Pairs well with most Asian foods and is a good antidote to anything spicy.  Made from good ingredients and water if you believe the label.
Pours clear gold with white head.  Pretty standard lager here, nothing special.

Bottle in green glass, EXP18102012, at 4.7% abv.  Lightly grass hops in the nose, sweet, medium corn.  Fizzy white head on a yellow body.  Taste is sweet, surprisingly grainy, artificial sweetener on top of corn, grass, very mild bitterness.  Light body fizzy with soapish character.  Unclean.
Basic Pale Lager, untasty and not very pleasant to drink. I had this one a long time ago. If I have the "chance" to drink it again, I’ll update this rating
Bottle - small foamy head, pale straw color, very generic pale lager aroma and flavor

07-FEB-2012, bottle @home, from "Superbest".
Nice golden color with almost no white head.
No nose at all. Perhaps just a little bitterness.
Sweet hayish malty taste.
Clean. Sweet. Ends just a little bitter.
Uninteresting. Will probably work in the heat, but not a high class product:-)

wow, this is a really poor drink (not even gonna call it beer!)
awful pissy yellow colour, not head but loads of bubbles.
slight whiff of malt. no flavour, might as well be drinking sparkling water.
UTTER PISH
Clear pale yellow colour. Smells like a regular pilsener, alcohol and malts. Tastes watery, sweet, bit cheap.. Okay pilsener.

Bottle. Nice balance of malt and hops in both taste and aroma. Thick white head over top of a pale yellow color. The mouth feel is lite like a pilsner. I didn’t detect a lot of extra flavors, but the ones I did made for a very pleasant beer drinking esperience.

Pale yellow color, med white head. Smells like straw and sweet malts and rice. Taste like rice, mineral water and sweet malts. Basic taste, but quite watery and thin. I do not find this offensive, but I would choose many other lagers over this one.

33cl found at Colruyt.
Dorée, col blanc.
Bière somme toute banale sur un bouquet doux de riz avec qcq cônes de houblon pour donner bonne cause, malt pâle.
En bouche, bien est pétillante, légère et reste douce dû au riz et se fini avec un côté amer léger du malt pale et du houblon.
Rien de spécial ici.

Bottle 330ml. January 27th, 2012


Bad malt taste, nothing good for me from this beer. A beer with no spectacular attributes but we need to taste a beer like that, if only, to better appreciate the good ones.

rating # 38
Bottle. clear golden color with a light white head. unappealing malt aroma . taste is very mild. very thin watery and nothing special. some cardboard as well...
30 cl. bottle @ my parents home. Yellow with a white head. Grassy hoppy aroma but not very strong. Taste is likewise. not bad or offensive but just plain boring pils
China’s most famous beer is just like most other lagers, exhibiting little aroma, flavor or palate.
Pours yellow with a smallm unstable head. Smells a bit yeasty, a bit of rice. Tastes quite boring. A bit hops (hay, grass, flowers) but nothing exciting.

Bottle & Mr Man’s Restaurant, Wollaton Road, Nottingham. For many UK drinkers, Tsing Tao is to Chinese restaurants what Kingfisher is to Indian restaurants - an inoffensive, mild flavoured pale lager which works as a decent complement to strongly flavoured food.  It can afford to be lazy in the taste and palate department - who will notice?  Not the kind of beer that stands up and gets noticed when drunk on its own. This has less flavour than its Indian equivalent, even paler in colour than many a pale lager, no hops of any note, hardly noticeable aroma and is rather watery. Select a bottle of Singapore’s Tiger Beer from the menu instead which is a more flavoursome companion to an Oriental meal and a decent lager in its own right.
It’s not the worst thing I’ve ever had but it’s pretty close...no malt, stale bland bitter hops of any.  Whole thing tasted like sour bath water.
Refrigerated bottle.  Clear yellow.  Taste is slightly malty with a hint of hops in the finish.
This completed my 3 lager night at Thai Paradise, This was not bad but again dont drink it alone, it goes well with the spicy Thai food
Pours golden yellow with no head. No bitter, bit sweetsour. It’s perfect for chinese meals :)
this is a fantastic asian lager, light with some of the finest hops around. I am enjoying this right now at Epcot at Disney World
Assez malté et houblonné mais sans subtilité et équilibre.  Aussi la ’moufette’ typique des bouteille non opaque.  Passez votre tour.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma is rice and corn with a metallic touch. Tastes like a typical below average mass-produced lager with added rice. Watery texture but sticky on palate.

Bottle.  Average aroma and flavor of yeast and hops.  Appearance is medium yellow.  Average carbonation.  Slightly sweet, clean finish.  Not a bad beer, but also not a great one, and definitely not one I’d likely to buy again.
Bottle from PF Chang. Pours clear yellow with a thin white head that disappears very quickly. Not much on the tongue except gasseousness. Metallic finish. Ugh!

Bottle. Pours clear and very light yellow. Aroma of skunk and malt. Thin and watery with some malt sweetness. Short and slightly bitter finish. Taste is a bit unpleasant. It tastes a bit like sweetened natural mineral water.

pours fizzy gold with some white head. smells like generic lager, tastes like generic lager although the malt is slightly more dominant than in other Asian beers I have recently drank. dry finish, light body.

Very mind skunkiness with a hint of hop sweetness. Very clear yellow and bubbly appearance. Mild bitterness with a mild sour finish that doesn’t linger long. Not too much different from most pale lagers. Nothing really negative but not much that stands out in a positive way either. I wouldn’t pass up it if offered but wouldn’t go out of my way for it.
Bottle. Light gold with a thin head. Aroma of musk. Light malty flavour, thin watery palate

Served in the green bottle. Think it looks like any other mass lager. Rarely say this but this is definitely skunky. Also has some white sugar notes and wheat. Very light. Taste is even more unremarkable. Could be a Heineken, Stella, Kronenbourg, Carlsberg, anything really. So little character and taste - even while being inoffensive - this can’t be justified. (33cl bottle)
Bottle.  Pours a thin gold with minimal head.  A pretty unremarkable beer.  Not much flavor of any kind.  It isn’t bad, just kind of dull.

Bottle. 12oz. Pours a weak white head, with clear complexion and yellow color. Sweet malty aroma. Malty flavor and sweet texture. A weak, but clean hop finish. Similar to most other lager in its category.
Lightly sweet aroma, but very light.  Flavor is clean but almost non existent.  At least no bad lingering taste because there is none.

12oz bottle from Pick’s poured into a lager glass. Pours a clear pale gold with about a finger of white head. Aroma of cereal grains and some light resinous hops. Taste is light bitter. Grains, rice and light hops. Slight bit of sour skunk also. Light-medium bodied with a thin and oily texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, not that bad. It still beats any "light" beer I’ve had.
Absolute garbage. The aroma was skunk and corn. The color was piss and the taste of any ingredient was non-existant.

33cl bottle. Very clear yellow piss with a little head. Nose : very weak layers of floral hops, citrus notes. Sip : water body with light carbonation. Citrus aromas more strong. Ending with little sour. Overall : Premium piss ...

330ml bottle. Light golden pour with little head that leaves no lace. Smells like a skunky green bottle beer with a slight hint of week old socks. Has almost no taste whatsoever and finishes with a slight taste of corn meal.
Vrij zoet pils met een beetje vreemde smaak (misschien de rijst?) Verder drinkt het prima als pils.

11.16.2011 - Houston, TX
Bottle

Very simple and watered down. Not much to it at all.

355ml bottle. Bottle in Canada at 5% ABV so I hope we’re following the rules here. Had it some time ago from the NSLC, I remember kind of liking it and thinking it reminded me of a fresher Eurolager. I’d try it again if I had the chance.
bottle at corte ingles, lisbon. You can get it at almost any chinese restaurant. Golden/yellow color. Lively carbonation. Cereal aroma. Thin texture. Almost no head.

From a bottle - pours golden yellow with thin white head with an immediate detection of a skunk smell but that seems to go away after a while. Has a taste of grain and corn and is well carbonated. This isn’t something that I would go out of my way to drink but I like it with cheap Chinese takeout or at the restaurant.
Clean, crisp tasting with a short clean finish. fantastically refreshing, nothing extra to report. One of my favorite lagers, simple and unpretentious, but its a bit one dimensional.
Ecco, vedi? Non l’avevo ancora saggiata; sono stato astuto a scroccarne un sorso dalla coinquilina che aveva preso cinese al takeaway.

I only rate this one because of my time in china.
light colour. dank smell, lots of funk and skunk and classic pils notes. tastes are light and somewhat sweet. boring stuff but i remember this being cheaper than Orange juice over there so can’t complain about that..I’d rather have this beer than OJ any day!
Bottle. Sweet with a small hop bitterness in the end. Quite lame, but not bad tasting.

Bottle at Chinese restaurant in Vejle. Pours clear yellow with almost no head. Very light aroma with hints of pilsner malt, corn and rice. Taste is light malty. Not a very good beer on its own, but it is very pleasant with Chinese food.
A light beer, both in taste and colour. Does not taste of much, but what taste there is, just tastes off.

Pale clear yellow colour, small white head. Aroma of malts, light taste, rather sweet. Rather sweet finish.

(From 33cL bottle, ABV  4.7%)

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a tasting cup.

The color is a clear yellow/orange with a slight wisp of white foamy that disappears quickly. Looks a lot like ginger ale.

The smell has a strong rice smell. There is a big of a corn aroma with some slight touches of some pilsner malts.

The taste is has slight malt flavor that is surrounded by more rice and corn flavor throughout. There may be a small bitterness that is given at the very end.

This beer does not thrill but it does have a smooth feel that seems to slide across the tongue and goes down with little effort.

In bottle. Pours a blonde colour with a thin white head. Aroma of bready yeast, caramel and barley. Very light with mild bitterness. Thin with similar flavours. Mild carbonation and CO2 prickle. Inoffensive.
Pours clear yellow with thick head and no lacing.  Tastes unusually sweet at the end, but other than that, just a cold fizzy drink on a hot night.

Date: October 1, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: BVery 
Extremely translucent golden with decent head, taste was not very good.
Bottle. Pale clear yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Nose is corn. Light palate. Taste is corn and wheat. Not good.

Poured from bottle into chilled pint glass. Light golden color with medium off-white head. Balanced, but no discernable hops aroma. Very slight yeast fruitiness, otherwise completely neutral taste. Nothing special, but I look forward to Tsingtao at Chinese restaurants.

Fles 33 cl. 
Kleur: Lichtgeel. Helder. Stabiele mooie witte schuimkraag.
Geur: Als van een doorsnee pils. Ook alcohol.
Smaak: Licht bitter, veel koolzuur.
Weinig (licht bittere) nasmaak

Dit chinese pils ziet er mooi uit maar is redelijk waterig.
Completely tasteless, no taste or aroma....watery, maybe the Chinese should just stay with egg rolls...they would be much better off staying away from brewing
weak drink ...too light and watery..more like a thirst quencher than a beer. do not understand why it is popualar in china. cheap ?
Extremt ljust öl. Smakar väldigt lite. Lite söt. Majs? Kan väl drickas till väldigt kryddstark mat men inte utan.

33cl Bottle.  Appearance is pale yellow color with medium, fizzy head.  Aroma is almost non-existent but mostly just a faith malty sweetness.  Taste is also conspicously missing - very watery, somewhat sweet, fizzy.  Palate is light-bodied, thin, watery, and sugary finish.  Just a downright awful beer - if you can call it that.  Perhaps carbonated, malt-based beverage is more like it.
Chinese restaurant.  My dad has been drinking this at Chinese places for years.  I do not really like it.  Taste is unpleasantly sweet.

Farblich blass-gelb startet das Tsingtao mit wässrigem Antrunk und bietet einen spülwasser-affinen Mittelteil. 
Der Abgang ist überraschend abrupt hopfig-trocken und das Beste an diesem Bier. 
Ein Allerwelts-Gebräu.Test vom 5.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

I saw I have not rated a china beer yet so I picked up one of these.  Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and little hops - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Watery, thin bodied and soft.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Pint glass.

Appearance: Light, clear golden-yellow with a minuscule head.

Aroma: Sweet grains, hay & straw, and very light apple. Slightly skunky from the green bottle.

Taste: Too sweet grainy malts with light straw and very faint metallic hops on the finish.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, light body. Should have a drier finish.

Overall: Meh. Kind of reminds me of Heineken, but maybe a little sweeter. Fortunately, it doesn’t get really bad as it warms, as Heineken does.

This beer really isn’t very good. Light golden in colour wtih some hoppiness on the nose but when drunk it’s very thin, lacking body, the hops don’ t taste overly fresh and the whole thing has that cheap hot country lager taste. I bet the barley content is variable and lower than the brewery would suggest.

Umm..don’t waste your money on the beer unless you want to say you had one from China (like myself).  Pours clear with minimal head and very little in the way of bubbles.  I should have taken those as real clues on how the brew would taste.  My instincts were correct...in a word: yeck!

0.33l bottle @ Cafe Spesial, Bergen. Bottle says ABV 4.7%. Pours your average lager body; golden and pale with a tiny sidesticking lager-head. Aroma is just wrong. Grainy and metallic, slightly sour and the good old wet dog has most likely taken a bath in the batch. Lively carbonated, light-bodied and it has a really watery mouthfeel. Guess it tastes a bit better than the aroma could suggest. Light corn-like flavors, kinda sweet and it ends really quickly in a thin watery finish. Actually not that bad with the food I had, so this went from a horrible smelling bad-lager to a mediocre premium lager.
Clear  yellow color with little head. Aroma of some hop. Good premium lager.
It was hot. Hemmingway hot. The beer was cool in my hand. It tasted of nothing, but nothing was what I needed.

Very light colour, a bit metallic on the nose. pale lager, with a hint of greenish hops. a bit of honey or something similar on the nose as well. surprisingly soft and full on the palate. a bit of bitterness, light taste, more corn-ish than malt.
Chineese Light. This has a nice aroma that comes off much stronger than its taste. This is quite light and crisp.
640ml bottle at 4.7%.  Pours a lively gold with a medium head.  Aroma is sweet hops and corn.  Taste has corn throughout with a sweet finish.

64 cl. bottle at a Chinese restaurant in Stockholm. Clear, golden colour with a thin white head that quickly faded. Aroma is very skunky with some sweet malts and hop notes. Very light bitter taste, light body. Somewhat skunky aftertaste. Not exactly memorable, but OK considering the style and descent.
Weak thin and watery, but at least you can detect some grassy hops in there. Clean and golden with no head or lacing, Tsingtao neverless quenches and is a fine pairing for spicy Asian cuisine.
Bottle 33cl. A clear light yellow colour with a small white head. An aroma of malt. The taaste is sweet. A light body, thin texture, avarage carbonation and a light bitter finish.
Bottle, small stable, clear pale yellow colour, herbal aroma with some malty notes, medium pleasant bitterness with some bready sweetness. Nice drinkable lager.
1/10 i mörkhet. Luktar väldigt lite, äventuellt lite fruktigt. Vattning med en lätt fruktig smak med en lätt besk eftersmak.
Bottle. A cheap skunky clear and golden beer with nothing really going on for it.
Pale yellow, no head. Aroma of hay, grass, light fruit. Thin, watery, oily grain, hint of fruit on the finish. Boring, but works very well with Chinese food!

Bottle 330ml @ China House, Odda

Pours clear pale yellow with almost no head. Aroma has notes of malt, rice and hay. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Pours pale golden with a low head. No aroma, very light flavor of malts. Well, at least it’s easy to drink.

Very clear golden look, faint white head dissapearing very fast. Some corn nose but not much aroma. Refreshing on the taste, lightly bitter but a bit watery overall. Light body, thin feel, average carbonation, and a short dry finish. Average lager.
It’s like a Chinese version of Corona. Smooth and refreshing, but not really beer.
Bottled. Very pale yellow color with almost no head. Aroma of malt, rice, some floral notes. Taste, watery, almost nothing, hints of malt, rice. Sweet, no bitterness, Bad.

Ännu en dag på jobbet, ännu ett öl i glaset. Tsingtao är lika spännande som automatkaffe, uppiggande som ett möte om ett kommande möte och intressant som ett massutskick. Kort sagt: ett öl för de dagar då allting är sig likt och livet fortsätter i samma spår mot evigheten.
The Tsingtao I’ve had was 4.7% ABV. To me it tasted like another mass produced lager. Nothing special.

330ml bottle. Very pale gold hue, thin white film head quickly diminishes. Malty aroma, grass, hay, with faint citrus. Moderate heavy sweet, mild to moderate bitter, faint sour.  Thin body, watery texture, light carbonation, dry finish. Soapy aftertaste  More pleasant than I expected, but easily forgettable.
Bottle, 5% ABV, pours pale yellow with no head, aroma of corn and rice with some malty tones, flavor of cardboard, mushrooms and rotten barley, light bodied with hoppy finish, not good

4.7% bottle at home. Another one that got away. We’ve all had this no end of times in Chinese restaurants the length and breadth I’m sure. Pale and fizzing with a sheet of froth. Deadening condition Vs some mildly fiery tom yum. Soapy aloe-like aroma with hints of wholemeal and pine. Clean taste: pine scrubbed with TCP clean in fact. Some corn and biscuits. Not bad.
Clear yellow with a white head.  Hay aroma.  Taste is sweet malt with some light hops.  Clean.  Decent body.

330ml bottle in a Chinese restaurant. Clear, fully carbonated pale yellow with a fine white head. Grain & sweet malt profile with an estery, rice & wheat dominance on the tongue from the mid palate onwards. Low bitterness, light body & medium to full carbonation.

0.64cl bottle at Chinese restaurant, 4.7%. Clear pale yellow with small but fine head, short lasting. Nose is a bit skunky. Aroma is straw, rice and some malts. Tastes rather sweet, modest sour, very light hoppy finish. Light body, average carbonation. Overall sweet and easy to drink. OK with Chinese meals, may be not exciting drinking it alone.
The Chinese equivalent of Corona, this beer has the same appearance going in as it does going out; yellow with a thin head. Boring.
my favourite beer from Asia. Great aroma as soon as your open it up, brilliant appearance of golden wheat, very satisfying crisp taste with a refreshing finish. Highly reccomend

Wie auch sonst bei asiatischem Bier gibt es eigentlich keine Schaumkrone, was dem GEschmack aber glücklicherweise nicht schadet. Schmeckt wässrig herb mit angenehm langen Nachgeschmack. Für chinesiches Bier sehr gut! 	 
Test vom 21.9.2004, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 6,10,8,9,11,9 - 8,80
Nice sweet lager that has more flavour than the usual European ones. Most Chinese restaurants serve it.

A: The beer pours a pale straw color with lots of visible carbonation and a short lived white head.

S: Lots of corn and rice aromas to it, which isn’t really surprising.  A light/pale malt aroma and a little bit of flowers and grass.  Minimal yeast and bread notes.

T: A light bready flavor with a surprising amount of malt flavor.  Light bitterness and grassy notes with just a hint of skunk.  Sweet grain, particularly from the adjuncts.

M: Light in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: A light and easy to drink beer.  Not really my favorite, but it goes well with a Chinese meal.

20110528 Home (4,7% bottle from Lidl): A yellow beer with a good thin white hed. Aroma: in the beginning some malt, sweet and hops. But this only for a very short period. Taste: some sweetness and a slightly bitterness in the aftertaste. A beer with less body. Typical for a beer which is produced with rice. Later is the taste a little sticky from the sweetmess. Maybe you must drink this beer very cold......
Not really much at all in the way of aroma or flavor.  Reminiscent of Dos Equis or Corona, although more like Corona because it has a nasty flavor edge to it.

I was really looking forward to this, since I’m eager to try different countries. So I found this Chinese beer a few weeks ago. Yesterday was the day to try and my god... Poured out in a regular lager glass, forming little head, smelling skunky and looking pale yellow. Almost light green. Flavour is weak, some metallic subtaste in it. Strange, because it comes out of the bottle. This is defintely not my favourite beer, more like one of my worst. Too bad."
Almost as bad as corona. Although the rice version. Has pretty much nothing but rice and corny shit in smell or taste, reminding me of corona. Crap
Bottle. A clear light yellow, pours with a small/medium white head. Aroma w. notes of hops and metal. Taste is corn, metal and hops, a bit bitter. Quite watery, unbalanced.
Bottle. A clear  light yellow, pours with a small/medium white head. Aroma is notes of hops and metal. Taste is corn, metal and hops a bit bitter. Quite watery and unbalanced carbonation.

Bottle at New World dim sum restaurant, Chinatown, London. Golden coloured pour with virtually no head. Not much aroma to speak of. Tastes slightly hoppy and actually went quite well with the sublime dim sum that I was eating. Not my choice of beer but it was OK for a meal with friends.
He probado esta cerveza infinidad de veces en China... y que queréis que os diga, no merece comentario alguno. Es la cerveza más común y popular en China, una cerveza de gran consumo más.

Usually a beer I order while in a Chinese restaurant.  Not a bad beer, nothing really great about it either.  I agree with other reviews, does have a slightly skunk aroma, and does have a bready taste.  I wouldn’t buy a case of it, but I will order another next time I’m in a Chinese restaurant.

(From numerous samples while in Qingdao, including at the brewery) Yellow-gold appearance with small white head. Bread, corn, light skunk aroma. Corn sweetness, lightly bready flavor. A slight bit above a typical macro pale.

From ?.
Bottled, 110411.
Just turned yellow with white head. Aroma of nothing. Flavor with some malt and hop notes. Watery palate

Crystal clear light yellow pour with small white head. Fairly neutral aroma which may be just my blocked nose. Light body as can be expected. Overall well balanced and refreshing. Better than expected when I saw it on the Chinese restaurant menu.

08.04.2011. 0,33l Bottle. Spesialbutikken Vaaland. Pale yellow colour with white head. Hoppy aroma with nice balanced bitterness. Refreshing beer with very nice aromatic fresh hops. Aftertaste is bitter and lasts at least for a while. Good lager.

Poured into a lager glass from 12 oz bottle. Colour is light golden, typical appearance for a lager. Aroma is very madly and yeasty. Served very cold, the flavour was mild. Some hop bitterness can be detected. Palate is smooth with good Carbonation. Overall a nice light beer to compliment a Chinese cuisine dinner.

found at lcbo, bought a bottle, opened and smelt stinks skunky. Poured out into glass light pale brown color, little head.  Again smell like skunk, bad batch exposed to light on shipment?   take a chug, sort of fizzy in the mouth, bitter and not that great going down.   This is not a good beer.  And I am going to china in may and this is their famous beer....
Bottle, label says 4,7% alc. Light yellow colour, almost no head, flat. Aroma has grain.Light taste, flat, almost no aftertaste, watery.

Bottle (640ml): This was a pretty avg. looking beer what was quite clear and pale. It smelt & tasted exactly as you’d expect from a pale lager with grain & corn dominating both categories and scoring about average in each. It was light on the palate, smooth enough & crisp but there is much better beers out there costing less.

More at:
abarwithnoname.wordpress.com
Golden carbonated with no head. The nose is slightly honeyed and metallic. The taste is of a sickening sweet vegetable oil. The palate is thin and unpleasant but cleans better than some cheap lagers.

The beer is a light clear straw with a thin white head.

The aroma is just hops and skunk and the same is said for the taste.

The feel is a little less watery than I thought but its drinkability is held back by a bitter skunked finsih.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a moderate golden straw color with a white head and a tiny amount of lacing as it goes down my glass. Nose is lightly skunked hops and a bit of grain. The taste is light grain and straw with some mildly herbal hops. Light body with good carbonation. Not a great beer, but drinks well enough.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-24-2010

Pours yellow lager colour but shade darker than most. Lots of clarity in the glass. Aromas are not strong. Bit of malt and grain. Taste is nice. Crisp, clean and refreshing and nice subtle malt notes and touch of bitterness. Very good with Chinese food, as a light counterpoint to oily spicy food. Rerated 10/08/11 - bit lacking in flavour so downgrading from 2.7 to 2.5.

Bottle:
Had this one many times before.
White airy head on top of a clear light yellow beer.
Smell malts, grains and some hops.
Taste malts, hops, grains, light sweet and a bit crispy.
Watery texture. Low body, low carbo and soft watery mouthfeel.

Jaune paille, laissant presque pas de col, aucune dentelle, faible effervesence, arôme de feuilles vertes, de pomme et de gazon.  Un peu sucrée, très timide amertume, Très courte en bouche, abrupte, aqueuse.  Froide, elle est rafraichissante, sans plus.
330ml bottle at the China Garden in Petit Saconnex. very pale gold and with gas. A little head.

Bottle.  I remember drinking heaps of this while travelling in China - now I can’t imagine why.  Pale yellow, small white head.  No aroma to speak of.  Thin, watery, a trace of malt, some generic lagery flavour.  Had this in an asian fusion restaurant. Couldn’t stand up to the flavours in the food.

Clear yellow pour, white head.  Aroma of some corn, touch of hay, some slight grain.  Taste is a touch of corn, some straw.  Watery finish.  I’ll pass next time I see this...but I do think its different/a change of pace from the american lagers.
Light straw color. Sparkling, with a medium-sized white head. Somewhat bland, with just a hint of tanginess. A very light floral smell.

Bottle. Pale golden clear with a white head. Smells fresh of malts and small hints of smokiness. Taste is sweet with some malts., some dryness in the finish. Finish has some bitterness. All in all a decent lager from a continent not known for their beer at all

12oz bottle. Pours a crystal clear, pale straw-yellow colored body with a thin, fizzy, white head that dissipates quickly and leaves a light lacing. Aroma is light and malty with some sweet cereal grains, corn, and a light grassy fruit. Flavor is similar. Sweeter, pale, grainy, cereal malts with a light grassy hopping. Finishes dry and crisp with a light, balancing bitterness, but its pretty bland. Short aftertaste following a light, crisp body and moderate carbonation. Overall, maybe I got a decent bottle, but this wasn’t as skunky or feet-ish as some of the other ratings. It was light and crisp with a bit of a sweet, cereal maltiness and a decent, but bland hopping. This isn’t as bad as some people have claimed, but its nothing to write home about.

12 oz bottle at a Chinese restaurant. Pours golden, crystal clear with almost no head. Low to moderate carbonation. Of all Asian beers I have tried (granted, I haven’t tried very many), I find Tsingtao one to be the most substantial and worthwhile. Body is still light, but texture is a bit thicker than other Asian beers. Not much to say about flavor. Not something I’d choose if there was a larger selection, but I’d take it over Sapporo any day.
Green bottled crap beer. The skunk reminds you of Chinese sewage, the color is pale gold.
This is not very good. It’s beer, though... and in case of an emergency, it will do.
Light yellow in colour with little head. Aroma is quite hoppy. Sweet taste of malt with hints of acidic fruit. Light bitter finish. It’s ok
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and fairly hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Watery, thin bodied and soft. 210211
Bottle 330ml. Pale yellow with small head. Neutral aroma. Weak, watery taste.
Pretty malty, typical rice/adjunct beer with a bit of a cleaner finish than some others.

640 mL bottle from Tesco poured into a pint glass.  Golden and with little gas (as poured straight in a couple of goes).   Consequently has a good head on it.  Nice hoppy and malty aroma.  Tastes a bit plain but very smooth.  Tastes a bit nicer than most over-malted lager but the flavour is in the aroma rather than the liquid.  Tastes reasonable and has a German purity about it (though obviously not Rheinheitsgebot), but could do with a couple more flavours to it.

Bottle at Chinese restaurant. Pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has some fruitiness along with a general lager aroma. Taste: slight bready notes, low bitterness, some grass, hints of fruit maybe. I also get an unusual taste that may come from the rice. Acceptable.

33cl bottle

Pours a yellow straw colored beer with a small white head.
 The aroma at first reminds me of medicinal herbs but shows his very slight maltyness after some time. The taste has the same strange flavor but has a more appearent malt flavor and in the end a slight mint aftertaste. Hop pressence is zero to none. The body is very aqueous.
Bottle in a Chinese restaurant on Kurfürstenstrasse in Berlin. Had it to the springrolls, but had to change to wine after that. 1 bottle more than enough.

Christmas gift from Cissy.  Thanks.  Hadn’t rated this one.  Clear gold pour with a thin white head that leaves a ring.  Asian lager taste except for thin and bland.  Not totally offensive, but not great.

Bottle. Absolute crap.Skunky hop aroma, wheat. White head, pale gold body. Bitter, with a bittersweet finish. 3 2 4 2 8 Bottle. Wheat, caramel. Anaemic gold body. White head with zero retention. Sweet. Nothing on the finish. Dryish. 4 2 3 2 8

Flaske 33 cl. Lys og bleg gylden hælde med et lille ubetydelih hvidt hovede aroma af malt og græsklæt humle. Sødlig smag af majs, noter af humle. Lidt tør mundfornemmelse. medium humle bitterhed i eftersmagen.
bottle.  Pretty standard premium lager.  No bad flavors, but a watery, bland finish.  Light, very light hop bite.  Grassy corn, hay.  Not bad, not good.
Bottle 330ml. Boring pale lager. Aroma of light citrus. Taste is sweet, and short-lived. Palate is thin and watery. Very pale, with no head.

I’m sorry but I must say it.  UGH!  First off this beer has a very weedy aroma.  It has the typical lager appearance to it but with very little head or carbonation.  If you’re looking for an "exotic" lager I’d look to Singha.  It’s not great either, but they do a much better job in the aroma and taste department.  This is honestly one of the worst beers I’ve ever had.

640 ml bottle my brother brought back from South Korea.  Not exactly a rarity here, but the label and size were unusual.  Pours a clear, very pale yellow with a head that starts strong and fizzes out quickly.  Huge skunk in the aroma, along with some corn, grass, and wet grains- nasty smelling.  Flavor of grass, seaweed, skunk, wet paper, grains, corn, and rice.  This is just really, really bad.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color. Mild aroma of hops and grain, but more on the weak side. Goes down easy with a light body. Very watery. Went well with heavy japanese food and sushi. Subdued, almost watery flavor reminded of cheaper American beers.

Very clear pale yellow color with a super white, soapy head.  Lots of bubbles.  Head retention wasn’t too bad and it left a decent amount of lacing.  Once the head was gone it left a fine little ring around the top.  Not too bad looking really.  A mild, somewhat grassy hop aroma.  Some floral notes and I am getting hints of an almond note.  Not bad at all.  This beer has a nice bit of sweetness to the flavor.  It was pleasant enough.  Some of the "grassy" hop flavor makes an entrance, but it was subdued.  A type of citrus in there also.  Maybe green grapes?  Puzzling.  Light mouthfeel that was very smooth and easy going.  Very crisp and only a slight bit watery.  Some flavoring was left on the palate, but not an over abundance.  This beer is easily drinkable.  Would be great during the Summer.  Very thirst quenching and refreshing.  Lacks a bit in flavor, but a beer for socializing without complexity.  A beer one wouldn’t have to ponder or try to analyze too much.

Bottle. Pours a clear straw yellow with fast fading white fizzy head. Aroma of skunk and a sharp malt back bone. Not much flavor here, light malt with light mild hop profile. Mouth feel is very watery with high carbonation. Overall, no wonder I overlooked rating this. It is easy drinking though.

Tasted 2010-12-18. Poured clear yellow with white head. A little too clean looking. Had a sweet and slightly acidic malt scent. Same with the taste. OK pilsner, but it doesn’t really need to be exported.

I have this or Sapporo everytime i have sushi and im not sure why, this beer is not worthy of any description, its crap! Im not into sake or hard alchool so next time im just going to have a glass of water with my sushi because this beer is a waste of money!
Pale yellow, thin head and no retention. Thin slightly grainy, sweet and fizzy burp beer.
Pale golden colour. Almost no head despite of rather determined pouring. Light and medium carbonated. Flavour is rather typical to rice beers. rather watery.
Bottle. Pale golden, no head. Aroma has grains. Thin and boring, however, it does not have any offensive tastes.
Very light color, like a yellowish water, not head. Very malty, slightly salty. nothing very unpleasant, but nothing pleasant either.
Typical macro lager trash. Taste is of gas water with sour apple flavoring.
